alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 3:37AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Strong Storm Moving to the Eastern Bering Sea and Chukchi Sea Wednesday Through Friday... A strong storm is developing in the Sea of Ohkotsk and will move to Chukotsk Peninsula Wednesday, and to Wrangel Island by Thursday morning. The storm will continue northeast into the Arctic Ocean on Friday. Strong southerly to southwesterly winds are expected to accompany this storm moving into the Eastern Bering Sea and Chukchi Sea Wednesday afternoon and evening with the weather front moving to the coast early Thursday morning. Behind the front winds will turn more westerly. This storm will bring potential for high surf and erosion to south and west facing shores from the Bering Strait to Norton Sound Wednesday night through Friday. In addition, elevated water levels bring potential for minor coastal flooding to low lying areas in Northern Norton Sound, and to Deering on the northern Seward Peninsula. There is a higher threat of coastal flooding and significant erosion from the Bering Strait north to Utqiagvik and Coastal Flood Watches have been issued for this area. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
